intro: Hieracium hirtelliceps, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium hirtelliceps is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
